station.name: Radio Balade FM
station.longDesc: Radio Balade FM 102.3 Stereo, launched on June 15, 2000, is a radio station based in Port-de-Paix. The Radio owned by Arne communications Network is aimed to provide those living in northwest and overseas the economic and social development coverage. Lou Evans ARNE is the director of the station broadcasting from Rebecca Street, Port de Paix, a town is the Northwest of Haiti. The FM will soon be available in broadcasting in Department of Artibonite on the dedicated frequency. Radio 102.3 FM promotes socio-cultural development, brotherhood, civil liberties, cultural and communal peace and harmony among the northwest in particular and Haitians in general. The bridge between North westerner overseas, Haiti and World is successfully educating, informing and entertaining the Northwest of Haiti. Be it the local Radio FM listeners or internet users everyone is getting their fair share of the political, social, economic and cultural insights prioritize by Radio 102.3 stereo FM. The Radio is preserving the history, music and culture of the region and sponsoring the rural life and healthy debates and discussions in the Diaspora.

station.name: Sans Souci FM
station.longDesc: Sans Souci FM 106.9 Cap-Haitien was conceived in 1991 under the name Radio Konbit as part of a process to national integration through decentralization. The project aimed to break the isolation of provinces facing the centralization of all decisions, activities and even information from the capital. The province should have its own voice. The implementation process was interrupted in September 1991 and resumed in January 1998 under the name of Sans Souci FM. The name and strategy have changed following the tragic assassination in August 1994 of one of the project sponsors. LТevasion totale is the slogan of the Cap-Haitien based station.

station.name: Radio Cacique
station.longDesc: Radio Cacique, a eu la premiere femme operatrice de radio en Haiti. Nous avons toujours fait de la defense de la liberte dТexpression notre cheval de bataille. En 1964, nous avons assiste au depart pour lТexil de deux de nos membres fondateurs: Roger San Millan et Anthony Phelps. Entre 1963 et 1969, les studios ont ete transportes a lТetage de la maison dТAdesky a la rue Traversiere. Durant cette periode, Gerard Camfort, Eddy Zamor, Wilson M. Pierrelus, Jacques Sampeur, Rockefeller Jean- Baptiste ont integre le staff. Certains se souviendront encore des emissions exclusivement dediees a lТorchestre de Nemours Jean-Baptiste Ђ cacique publicites ї et Ђ battant pavillon rouge et blanc ї sans oublier les emissions de musiques haitiennes animees par Jacques Sampeur et plus particulierement, celles du samedi reservees au Tabou Combo. LТauditorium (radio theatre) de Radio Cacique, a egalement vu defiler nombre dТartistes et dТ orchestres tels, ceux de Nemours Jean-Baptiste et de Webert Sicot, des mini jazz comme les Ambassadeurs, les Diplomates, les Vickings dont Jean-Claude Carrie ex- directeur de Radio Cacique et musicien consomme en etait le parrain. De 1969 a1972, Radio Cacique vit ses studios transportes a la place Jeremie (bas peu de chose), au restaurant dansant Ђ lТOasis ї (a cote du cine Eldorado), propriete du bien connu, journaliste, ex dirigeant du groupe carnavalesque Ђ LOBODIA ї, ex-maire de Port-au-Prince : Andre Juste qui, lui aussi, a pendant de nombreuses annees fait partie de notre staff.

Les emissions sont diffusees a la television et a la radio. Elle diffuse egalement diverses productions provenant d'autres stations de radio et de televisions tant au niveau national qu'international. Dixit Le PDG JUNIAS JEAN JACQUES.

station.name: Hit Fm Haiti
station.longDesc: La Radio de toutes les Generations

station.name: Radio Tele Perfection
station.longDesc: Radio Tele Perfection 89.5 FM Port-de-Paix is an adult contemporary station catering the needs of Haitian youth with new style and trends. The mythologicial characters, local inhabitants have their own way to conduct the programs and tell the stories. Audiences will be obliged to find the Perfection online and can feel free to leave what they think should be there; the staff would be more than happy to respond you. The Live 24?7 broadcasts consist of Haitian Talk, local content, cultural show and non-stop musique.

station.name: Radio Vision 2000
station.longDesc: Radio Vision 2000 is a broadcast radio station from Port-au-Prince, Haiti, providing spiritual programs in the morning, news and sports.

station.name: Radio Mag-Horizon
station.longDesc: Radio Mag-Horizon (RMH) 101.9 FM Saut DТeau launched on January 19, 1996 broadcasts from the heart of Plateau-Haiti. Ernst Exilhomme is the director general of the 101.9 FM. The English and French language educational FM, broadcasts across Haiti and Caribbean with a significant listenership. The institution is at the service of masses of the Department du Centre and surrounding areas. The channel is not for any traditional media design which aims to consider the audience as a mere object to be manipulated. Radio Mag-Horizon apart from broadcasting Health, informational and entertainment based programs is a real tool for social and cultural transformation. The team works body and soul to bring the best to its audiences.

station.name: Radio Deca
station.longDesc: Ce site a pour objectif de vous presenter  Deca FM. Vous y decouvrirez la presentation et l'actualite de la radio. Vous pourrez obtenir plus d'informations sur nous et nous contacter.  Deca FM  est basee en Haiti a Vieux Bourg d'Aquin et emet sur ie 104.3 FM.

station.name: Zerzer Fm
station.longDesc: L'image du Vodoo Haitien

station.name: Harmony Fm
station.longDesc: We are live on the net 27/7 playing love, hits haitian kompa music, reggae, hip hop kreyol, evagile gospel

station.name: Detente FM
station.longDesc: Detente FM 94.1 is a Haitian station broadcasting World music and other Caribbean genres. Audiences can enjoy the lively Haitian talk and connect with the skilled, welcoming and responding team of the radio. The regional content/issues, happenings, live music and cultural programs are the key contents of the content produced by channel mainly in English; however, Haitian Creole and French also make the transmissions.

station.name: Radio Tele Fhaeh
station.longDesc: Radio Tele Fhaeh 107.5 FM Saut-dТEau is a FM station based in Haiti. The Mix-format channel broadcasts a wide range of content ranging from information to entertainment from the commune of Saut-dТEau. Listeners of the 107.5 FM can listen to the News, informational content, cultural programs, daily Sports stories, non-stop Haitian and Caribbean music and lot more. Peterson Jeanty is the Director General and Rose Andre Seide is the PDG (CEO) of the Fhaeh . Aider, Former et informer la Communaute (Help, Train and Inform the community) is the mission of the Radio Tele Fhaeh 107.5 FM. The website of the Fhaeh 107.5 FM is a one place for all the transmissions and engaging posts for Haitians which are updated on daily bases. Visitors can read Actualites, Sports stuff, cultural posts, Carnavals, festivals, archives, podcasts and everything with a link to Haiti with significant meaning is there for the listeners and readers. You can read the articles, popular ones from the best writers across Haiti. Radio Tele Fhaeh is available on AudioNow for the listeners to receive the streams on their mobiles by calling on 712 832 2752. The fans can always find Radio Tele Fhaeh 107.5 FM to make a social connection.

station.name: Radio LJS
station.longDesc: Radio Tele Ljs Canal 7 et 100.3 fm Stereo Depuis La rue Louverture #137 Saint-marc, Haiti. Fondee le 15 Aout 1991 Par Ulysse Louis-Jeune A pour mission d'etre La Lumiere de la jeunesse Saint-Marcoise

station.name: Radio Tele Centrale
station.longDesc: Radio Tele Centrale 91.7 FM founded on July 15, 2003 aims to inform, educate, train and entertain the masses of the largest Artibonite department. Louis Jean is the PDG (CEO) of the station. The channel broadcasting from Liancourt, Saint-Marc comes with different approach towards content.

station.name: Radio Lambi
station.longDesc: Radio Tele Lambi, fondee a Corail dans la GrandТAnse, le 27 juin 1997, et maintenant sise au 76, rue Stenio Vincent (Basse Ville), Jeremie. Elle emet sur le 103.9 FM et le 104.1 FM Stereo, et la Chaine 4 pour la Television. De son PDG, l'Honorable Senateur Michel CLERIE, la Radio Tele Lambi arrive a avoir une couverture Departementale sure, mais elle atteint aussi les autres cotes du Territoire Haitien(ex.: L'ile de la Gonave, l'Ile de la Tortue, Petit-Goave, Fort-Liberte) et dans les hauteurs de Port-au-Prince, la capitale. Toujours avec les meilleures programmations, elle touche et entre petit a petit dans les quotidiens des Haitiens en Haiti tout comme a l'etranger.

station.name: Radio Zone Inter
station.longDesc: Radio Zone Inter 101.1 FM Cap Rouge launched on August 23, 2012, is Haitian owned music station, a project of Zone a company launched on August 18, 2007, which has reached to over 760,000 Haitians in the country and 230,000 expatriates in South Florida, the 2nd largest of the communities. Haitian Creole and French are the languages of the FM 101.1 propagating the Caribbean rhythms such as Compas, Zouk, Konpa, Salsa and others.

station.name: Constellation Fm - La Station de lТinfinie!
station.longDesc: A constellation is a group of stars which make up imaginary outline or pattern in the night sky, this is why we called our Station after Constellation.

station.name: Kitelmache Radio
station.longDesc: Kitelmache Radio is an internet radio station from Haiti providing Pop and Tropical music.

station.name: Radio RTDI
station.longDesc: Contribuer a la propagation de l'Evangile par l'information et la formation. Sa philosophie est axee Sur le service, en vue d'un changement de comportement.
